mdRecord.dcterms:title: October Camp Diversity Rally on Lawn
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Harrison, Peggy, 1960-
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From excerpt: Rained out October 4, 1999, the student group Advocates for Diversity in Education postponed their overnight event to celebrate diversity on Grounds for two days and the sun shone down upon them. Faculty and administrators gave talks and led small groups, the UVa African Drum and Dance Ensemble performed, and the discussions continued through the evening, as a small but hardy band camped in tents set up on the lower Lawn.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
